marklogic.body: Yup.  The reason there's a glow in the sky is that they're Burning the stuff - as they almost Always are in some of the refineries in New Jersey and Pennsylvania. A few years back I was living in Alameda County, California.  My wife woke me up around 5:00 one morning in a panic because of the bright purple-green glow in the sky, and asked which direction Livermore was.   (Different direction, fortunately, so it wasn't the nuke labs exploding 10 miles away, it was an electric substation that had caught on fire about 10 miles north of us, but it was a very wrong color, almost octarine.)
